I think we're generally trying to avoid having newlines in translation messages? @hebasto

Yes. As I mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/476#issuecomment-974891494, we cannot be sure that the chosen location of the hardcoded `
` is optimal for translated strings.

If the problem is the breaking `-listen=0`, why do not use a nonbreaking hyphen:
```suggestion
                _("Failed to listen on any port. Use ‑listen=0 if you want this."),
```
?
Breaking text at the end of the sentence would be cutest.\n(at least at that macOS build).\nBreaking text before `-listen=0` is good enough as a first step.
